page.title: 12UPTON VILLAGE
page.content: Upton village lies on the extreme southern edge of the area. There is a church, a methodist chapel, a garage and the only shop in all the area of the Brendon Hills that we surveyed. The old part of the village has some lovely stone houses which are very well cared for and there are also some large new bungolows being built on the main road (B 3190). The garage has petrol (at Â£2.04 a gallon when we were there) and also does repairs but there were no cars for sale there. The man who built the garage used to live in the house which now houses the local Post Office and villge shop. The man who serves petrol at the garage does not live in the village but travels there from Bampton every day, about six miles.
